p: Next, we examined the effect of viral envelope SM depletion on IAV attachment and internalization. A549 cells were inoculated with bSMase- or vehicle-treated PR8 at 15 MOI at 4°C for 1 h. The binding of the SM-depleted virus was significantly reduced compared to the vehicle-treated one ( Figures 7A,B). To assess the entry of the SM-depleted virus, the cells were incubated at 37°C for 30 min following adsorption. The bSMase-treated virus displayed reduced internalization compared to the vehicle-treated virus ( Figures 7C,D). These findings indicate that viral envelope SM-depletion reduces both binding and internalization of IAV, resulting in suppressed infection.
